title: Corporate Stationary
content:
Hi chaps,

Just a courtesy post to ask if anyone has spotted web site links on their travels to company stationary design? Has anyone got any favourite’s they like… Many thanks in advance.

br Wooly
author: Wooly

comments.content:
Is that a standing corporation? As in stationary? It should be <cite>stationery</cite>, as in:  
Middle English staciouner, a bookseller, from Medieval Latin statinrius, shopkeeper (as against a peddler), probably from Latin stati, statin-, place of business. ( [http://www.bartleby.com/61/92/S0719200.html](http://web.archive.org/web/20060207023300/http:/www.bartleby.com/61/92/S0719200.html))

A frequent mistake, almost as frequent as spelling <cite>seperate</cite>, rather than <cite>separate</cite>. Latin <cite>separare</cite>, to divide (no source, just my memory).

Sometimes it is easier to look in from the outside. My native language is German.
